comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: British polo team that won the International Polo Cup in 1914: Maj. Frederick W. Barrett, Capt. Leslie St. Claire Cheape, Capt. Vivian N. Lockett, Capt. H. A. Tomkinson, and John Traill. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Polo_Cup

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Cheape (c1882-1916) died in WWI; has a wiki entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leslie_Cheape His sister, Mrs. C. P. Kay, was one of the victims of the 1914 "Empress of Ireland" disaster, which is also part of this week's LOC uploads to Flickr Commons.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: They arrived on May 31, 1914 on the Cunarder Carmania according to next day's NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30A13FB3A5B13738... The competition between the national teams was in decided on June 16. See NYT of June 17, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60811FF3F5E13738...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
pennylrichardsca & swanq:

Thanks for the more complete names and information about this group of gentlemen. We will expand the descriptive information when we update this record.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Here is the manifest of them arriving aboard the RMS Carmania on June 1, 1914 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/richard_arthur_norton/5589785769] I tried to start an entry for each person in Wikipedia that did not have an entry already: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leslie_St._Clair_Cheape (as pointed out above) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vivian_Noverre_Lockett en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_W._Barrett en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Archdale_Tomkinson en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Arthur_Edward_Traill Others arriving on June 4, 1914: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5496668541/in/photostream] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5496668395/in/photostream]
